Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location. And a nice hotel, too!”
Reviews.Author: Noncamper
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four-night stay at Lope de Vega. I need to return to Madrid in a few weeks, and I will probably stay there again. You can't get any closer to the Prado, yet it's on a quiet side street. It's an easy walk to Atocha train station to the south or Plaza de Cibeles to the north, where you can get the Metro or buses. Room was very clean and comfortable, and hotel was quiet. Air conditioning worked great. Front desk staff was superb, especially by Spain standards. One woman was especially pleasant and helpful, and I am annoyed that I did not write down her name to write a commendation to the hotel. Sofia, perhaps? My only (small) complaint is that the internet is pretty slow, at least in the rooms. Not a problem for just checking my email, but it would be more annoying if I needed it for business.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel superb location”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumLudo
Reviews.Content: Small and good quality hotel with value for money and above all incredibly wonderful located ! Friendly personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and quite reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Sofiastayshome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lope de Vega in December 2011 and are heading back next month. The location could not be better: three minutes walk to the Prado, ten minutes or so to the Atocha railroad station, and eight on the edge of the old part of town with its restaurants and fun places to walk. The staff is very competent and responsive. The rooms are clean and modern feeling. The breakfast is okay too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jojaSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed at the Hotel Lope De La Vega this past June 2012 for 5 nights total--three nights at the start of our 2 week trip to Spain and then 2 nights at the end of our trip. The hotel staff was warm and welcoming from the start-- they let us check in early after an overnight flight from the US. The hotel is an easy, pleasant walk from the Atocha Train Station. The breakfast buffet (which we had as part of our room fee) was excellent: many cold and hot food choices including a wide variety of pastries and breads, yogurt, meat, cheese, tortilla Espanol as well as beverages and coffee/tea. The location is fantastic-close to the Prado as well as the Reina Sofia and the Thyssen museums. The Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor are an easy (uphill) ten minute walk. There are many interesting small shops, restaurants and markets in the neighborhood. I recommend the hotel and plan on staying there the next time we travel to Madrid ( which hopefully will be soon as it is a great city to visit) One more thing, the bathroom was comfortably sized and had an amenity kit in addition to the soap/shampoo/lotion that we had expected. I would recommend taking the time to walk to the nearby Buen Retiro Park--it is a fantastic city park a few minutes walk from the Prado Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Spanishpassion
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and it was a pleasant stay. Only complaint is that at times you can hear your neighbors. Front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Bed and pillows were fine, room a little tight, but adequate for the stay. We were pleasantly surprised that you could pay 5 euros for a continental breakfast and it was sufficient to start the day. Very close to Prado Museum and situated in a quiet street. Have stayed in a few Madrid hotels, and liked this hotel the most. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ETB_12
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a one week visit to Madrid, and stayed in the Lope de Vega hotel. we enjoyed very much the hotel for its perfect location, Room size And the very helpful hotel staff. The only downsize was internet slow connection. We would definitely come back to the Lope de Vega hotel on our next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Convient n Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Frank V
Reviews.Content: By luck my friend n I found the Hotel de Vega, it turn out to be the best luck we had in our trip to find such a convient spot to operate from to the visits of places to see in Madrid....also the clerks were very friendly helpful...they went out of their way to help with the computor and sights to see...n recommendations of Spain sights...I am booking there next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jen W
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. It was very clean, the staff were friendly and our room was excellent. In the daytime we walked to the Prado (two minutes away), the Botanic Gardens (five minutes) and the Reina Sofia (about 15 minutes walk) . In the evenings we enjoyed the excellent streets of little tapas bars two minutes in the other direction. The bocadillo bar that you reach if you walk directly out of the hotel and to the right is excellent, with great coffee too. We booked our room with breakfast and were impressed - there was loads to choose from and it was all good quality. Plus, they serve it from 7am til 11am (check out is 12noon) so it's an excuse for a lie in if you've been out the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: mountaineers2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lope de Vega is located a short distance from the Prado, the Estation Atocha, and many dining and shopping experiences on a quiet side street. From there, we walked to all of the main attractions in Madrid. It is clean, well appointed, and has a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid to Marbella and back again”
Reviews.Author: michwild
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lope de Vega in early April, 2012. We first stayed for four nights while we toured Madrid, then we bounced back for a quick overnight before we left Spain. The room was good, with a comfortable king sized bed and a pull out couch. There was a pocket door that separated the bedroom from the living room area. We also had a lovely patio (a 7th floor balcony) that had a lounge chair and a table and two chairs. The hotel offers free wifi, apples and mints in a bowl in the hallway, writing paper and amenity packages with toothbrushes, razors, toothpaste, shaving cream, comb, tissues, and a sewing kit. There was also shower gel and shampoo. Very convenient! We did not eat breakfast here as it was very expensive. There was a great bakery around the corner and a cute organic cafe up the street where we were able to eat. I'd also recommend tapas and cervezas at La Delores, which is locted on the corner of Lope de Vega as you proceed up the hill. We liked this location. The Prado and Botanical Gardens were about a block away and we were able to walk to Reina Sofia, Puerta del Sol and the Royal Palace. We found that our tourbook maps were somewhat deceptive in that things were much closer than they seemed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Soflocal
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for visiting the museums and then going out at night. Lively neighborhood is just a street or two over, so you can get drinks and tapas at several spots, but the hotel is quiet. Clean,efficient, no frills hotel, with veeeery slow wifi. But all in all a good value and a pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our vacation in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Mehdi G
Reviews.Content: Positive: Very good location,close to center of city, close to main rail station, freindly staff. Negative: Beds can be a bit cleaner, although was quite ok. A bit more verity of breakfast can make this hotel a very good place to saty. We stayed with our family (2 couple with one child) and we were statisfied.

Reviews.Title: “from Boston's North Shore”
Reviews.Author: pie3133
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for visiting museums & gardens. Very friendly & exceptionally helpful desk staff. Buffet breakfast really varied & quite good. Room very clean and beds very comfortable. Plain room with modern bathroom and a little patio (back room, not on street side of building). Earplugs blocked all noise from adjoining rooms. Will definitely stay there again & again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anahimart
Reviews.Content: A perfect starting point each day. Walked to hotel from train station with suitcase, stroller and 1yo. Very short walk. Don't ask the guy next to the train station (newspaper guy) for directions. I had a 1yo with me and said "excuse me may I ask you a question?". He said "no". I speak Spanish so it wasn't a language barrier. I thought he must be joking and said "I just need to know which direction is the Prado museum". He answered "did you not hear me? I said no questions.". And he didn't tell me!! I don't care how bad your day is, there is no excuse to be that rude. Madrid is not as kid friendly as Barcelona. Hi chairs are scarce. We took a fabric chair that attaches to ANY chair and were fine. Hotel was great. We arrived early and they accommodated it. Didn't do breakfast, as it was cheaper out of hotel, and more varied. Great hotel for visiting museums too!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tommywelltravelled
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay in Hotel Lope da Vega, Madrid. The hotel room was very clean, the staff were pleasant and helpful. While our room faced the street, we had no issues with noise etc. The excellent and varied breakfast set us up for a busy day's sightseeing. The hotel is ideally situated opposite the Prado and enables a visitor to be close to all of the sights of central Madrid. It was our first visit and we thoroughly enjoyed this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Needs sprucing up”
Reviews.Author: JMC130
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at another 4 star hotel in Madrid just a couple of weeks earlier, I assumed that Hotel Lope de Vega would be on the same par. Unfortunately I was terribly wrong. I had called earlier in the day requesting a quiet, sunny room. The first room I was assigned to was on the main floor and was anything but quiet. The second room was on the back of the hotel (dark) and located on a smoking floor. I do not smoke nor do I enjoy the smell of cigarettes. I could not understand why they would not have asked me prior to putting me in a smoking room whether that would have been an issue for me. The front desk staff acted as though I was insane for finding fault in that. I wound up in a third (noisy) room for which I had to pay an additional 10 euros per night. It was definitely not quiet. Their rooms were all worn and weary. They could all use a good coat of paint and some additional decorative touches. The walls are paper thin. The bathroom was okay except for the huge rust stain running down the side of the shower wall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Threeeee
Reviews.Content: Nice, friendly staff. Room was very clean and comfortable. Just across the street from Museo Del Prado which was one of our main destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Prof19
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel, especially given its reasonable price. It is indeed located right across the street from the Prado and right near all of other major musuems. The rooms are reasonable size, have a large safe for laptops, a modern bathroom, large windows/balcony, excellent lighting. The best part was the fantastic buffet breakfast, included for free in the senior package.

Reviews.Title: “Chosen for proximity to museums, it delivers”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the bathroom nicely sized. We were on the last leg of our Spanish journey, and were very pleased with this as our last hotel before leaving. Set back from the street, the room was relatively quiet with respect to outside noise. We had a small balcony overlooking the side street, which was very nice. The floors are a hard surface, though, and the noise from the room above was excessive. Our bad luck to be situated under a room full of (apparently) wooden-clog-wearing insomniac children who like to play the bang-bang-bang game, but some rugs might help that. Staff was helpful with internet questions, though the wifi signal was very weak in the room, and they arranged a cab to the airport for us. And if the three big art museums are your target, you would do very well here. The area is lovely, nice restaurants abound. I would stay here again (perhaps requesting a room on the top floor.)

Reviews.Title: “good value and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: WageandBabo
Reviews.Content: In the bathroom there was a box of amenities: lot of goodies: razor, toothbrush and paste, comb, shower cap, sewing kit, tissues, in addition to the regular soap and shampoo. We sprang for the breakfast and it really improved my morning. (see hotel website for full spread of foods). The hotel is halfway between Atocha and the Banco de Espana metro stop, but not really immediately near any metro station. Hotel is very convenient to the Prado and the Thyssen-B. art museums. Also next to the administration building for social services and hygiene (?) so it's not a noisy neighborhood at night. For the price we paid, I was very contented, as this was my last stay before leaving Spain. The only downside was that the staff gave us two pieces of misinformation about some places we went (which wasted some of our time later) but this should not be a problem for other travelers. There is a busy restaurant around the corner (albeit touristy) that is open very late (11pm) and up the block very close by there is a VIPs (carry out sandwiches and fast food) that is open until 3am weekdays and 1am Sunday-Monday if you arrive back very late and need some food to eat. Bathroom is comparatively nice sized to other european hotels and there is room to move about in the bedroom area. And unlike a lot of hotels I stayed in while in europe, this one had a TISSUE BOX in the bathroom and a trash basket in the bedroom. (thank you!!) There is a bowl of fruit and a bowl of candy on each floor in the elevator area, stationery paper and envelopes for the guests. Computer is downstairs by front desk for guests, and you can get wifi if needed. No free coffee or tea though. The door to the room was a little tricky to open (which way to turn the key to get the door open took some practice).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: IJS63065
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by friends who had stayed there and it was just as they said. The location for the museums was excellent, it was near Atocha for a train trip to Toledo, not far to the underground and in spring or summer it would be ideally located for the Retiro park. In the street behind the hotel there were plenty of places to eat and drink without having to go further after a strenuous day of sight- seeing. The price fot a 4 star hotel in a major city was excellent.We didn't need any extra services and the reception staff were very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Two Days in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Gracey922
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Madrid, and first stay at this hotel. It was very convenient to the museums, Atocha train station and nice walk to some of the major plaza's. We arrived before noon and our room was not ready. However, they offered to store our luggage and by the time we checked in, within 15 minutes they had a room available. The hotel and room was very clean and staff most accomodating. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place ,close to the Prado Museum”
Reviews.Author: labe7000
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this place for summer vacation . It is conveniently located across the Prado museum and walking distance from many points of interest .Staff was very friendly.My room was nice and clean .I had a fruit basket in my room .Breakfast buffet was very good. I definitively would go back to this Hotel in Madrid .

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: a-westofboston
Reviews.Content: Arrived very very early on Sunday morning. The staff was apologetic that no room was yet available (many guests were still sleeping-never mind checked out). But they did say they would try to get a room ready for us as early as possible. They were good to their word and had one ready for us by 10 am. We could not have asked for better on that score. The room was immaculate, very quiet and the beds were really comfortable. There were apples and candies in bowls when you got off the elevator. The breakfast was a fantastic spread of all kinds of breads, pastries, cheeses, fresh fruit, meats, hot dishes, coffee, teas, on and on. The hotel had a great location if you wanted to go to the Prado and was walking distance to other sights as well. We happen to have gotten a great Travelocity rate--no other site offered a rate that good, not even the hotel directly, so we had a particularly great value for our euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for museums and tapas bars."”
Reviews.Author: Keota
Reviews.Content: Within easy walking distance to El Prado and other museums. Convenient to several plazas featuring tapas bars. Our room on the second floor had an inside patio with table and chairs for relaxing in the daytime. We arrived early and the courteous staff stored our luggage in a secured room until check in time. Most of the staff spoke English and were quite helpful. Breakfast is continental or buffet in the same location. Be sure you know the limits of the continental and don't stray in to the buffet section or you will be charged for the more expensive buffet. Dining room is attended, neat and orderly. WiFi was used daily.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: ajzmann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first leg of our Spain honeymoon earlier this month. Our flight got in early in the morning, so we were unable to get into our room, but the staff was kind enough to hold our bags for us so we could explore during the day. The check-in process was smooth, and the staff was very friendly. Our room was clean (and timely made up each day) and rather spacious for European hotel standards. The best part about the hotel? The location, of course. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go (the Prado, the Botanical Gardens, Retiro) and it's also within walking distance of the train station which was perfect for our day trip to Toledo and for our departure a few days later. I'd stay here again in a heart-beat. The room was clean, staff accommodating and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find. Great location and great value. I always stay here on business as it's much more friendly than other hotels. The breakfast is excellent value, good choice, and nice breakfast room. The rooms are fine, nice big bedrooms, nice beds, television, minibar, etc. Bathrooms are fine, nice toiletries. Nothing too fancy, but more than just the basics. And the location couldn't be better - right across the street from the Prado. Staff are all polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “M&L”
Reviews.Author: Maribel M
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location! Very safe area and close to everything of interest. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Room was comfortable & clean. Breakfast buffet was perfect! We are looking forward to visiting Madrid & staying at this same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: TheKonya
Reviews.Content: I'd stay here again. Staff was helpful, informed, accomodating and informative. Rooms were comfortable, and clean. Location is perfect--Prado and Retiro, Airport amd train bus.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay in this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: peggywedg
Reviews.Content: My husband and 16 yr old son stayed at this hotel while visiting Madrid after having visited Barcelona and other cities in northern Spain. The walls are so thin, we could hear the young girls in the rooms on our floor when they would come in and continue partying all hours of the night. Moreover, the air conditioning is turned off during the day by the cleaning staff, so when we would return in the late afternoon after having walked outside in the heat, we would have to wait for two hours for the room to cool down which it never got cold. The hotel was very impersonal (really depressing) and not helpful with information since we had a rental car and had to return it. The area is great, but I will find another hotel in the area when we visit Madrid the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family of 3 with teenager”
Reviews.Author: JOGAgirl
Reviews.Content: As it was difficult in Madrid to find hotels that allowed more than two people per room, Hotel Lope de Vega was very accommodating with their fold-out bed/chair. We found the hotel to be very quiet with the exception of the lady pacing over our head for a few minutes each night around midnight. Then, all was quiet for the rest of the night. (Four out of the five hotels we stayed in Spain had wooden floors so some noise is to be expected. Ask for the top floor to avoid this.) Our room was presented as expected and kept impeccably clean for the three days of our stay. The Atocha train station is within a 15-20 minute walk and two Metro subway stops are within an easy 5-10 minute walk. And, of course, the Prado Art Museum is right across the street. Estado Pura is a sensational restaurant around the corner for tapas. Best we had in Spain! And VIPS is convenient (and cheap!) for breakfast, lunch, with an attached market and bookstore for edibles to go. We would definitely stay at Hotel Lope de Vega again!

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem?”
Reviews.Author: Tanderra
Reviews.Content: I don't know what these people are grizzling about. The hotel was very quiet. Peaceful in fact. The rooms are very comfy. The breakfast is excellent - among the best I've had in Europe. Staff very friendly and helpful at all times. Location magic - right opposite the Prado. Taxis abound, railway station nearby. I had a slight issue with the wi-fi one day but maybe that was me. Imaginative theme re Lopa de Vega.

Reviews.Title: “loud, lacking some basics”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelalot
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a good location and was a reasonable price with the exception of the parking fee. the hotel had a very big issue with noise. the rooms had no insulation and around 7 am you could hear banging of doors and staff initiating their work. you could hear a neighbor flushing a toilet and running water in other rooms. this hotel also lacked some basics, there was no coffee or tea maker in the room. Breakfast was available at an additional 12 euro. they did have a wheelchair adapted room but it was poorly designed without a shower seat, peep holes and makeup mirrors hung out of reach. bathroom so small it was hard to negotiate and patio had a step. overall hotel not very user friendly and madrid an mainland spain in general behind it's european counterparts with accessibility in general.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid in winter. Awful heating system.”
Reviews.Author: Gracian88
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 25 Nov. to 3 Dec. 2010. It was impossible to warm up the first room I got. It was on the 6th floor, next building had 4 floors and the wall of my room had no insulation. It was like having an open window. Next day I got a new room. This time it was on the 1st floor. I discovered that next building was empty. No insulation either. Moreover, the floor was in polished granite, and the room below (the library) was not heated. I left early every morning and came back late. I found every evening that the cleaning lady had put off the heating in the morning, so I had to put it on again and wait until the room was warm (it was a warm air system). Obviously, this building was made in the 70's, when there were no regulations about thermic or acoustic insulation in Spain. Now they warm the air with an electric system. I imagine they spend a fortune in heating, and give instructions to every employee to spare energy. The breakfast room was always cold. The lady in charge complained every morning. Even when the heating was on, it was seldom warm. This is a hotel to avoid in winter. Moreover, the nearest subway stations were quite far. They were at ten minutes distance, it is true, but this means one kilometer!

Reviews.Title: “Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Supbicou
Reviews.Content: One problem: i could not connect with the wifi ! Someone Can give me his wifi code ? (I may return for work) Otherwise, it was all right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean and close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: MikeSaraChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the recommendation of a friend becuase we were coming in on the AVE high speed train and it was close. It would be a long walk, but we did not walk since we had a lot of luggage. The staff was friendly, spoke English and helpful. We used the computer downstairs. They have Wi-fi but we could not get the iphone to connect.

Reviews.Title: “Bountiful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bdegroot
Reviews.Content: In addition to its great location and helpful staff, this hotel has a lovely breakfast featuring several varieties of ham, delicious pastries, fresh fruit and perfectly made coffee. We also loved our little balcony overlooking the street and the free Internet in the lobby. Yes, there was some noise at night, but if you are noise-sensitive, bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “NO PEACE TO BE HAD HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: gina58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel with my husband for two nights. Lovely Hotel excellent central position,clean, tidy etc. However, due to the wooden flooring had two sleepless nights as could hear every step taken in the room above ours and lots of scraping of chairs etc!! Great shame as this spoit our stay here. If we go back to Madrid will certainly not be staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “would come here again”
Reviews.Author: jeffweil
Reviews.Content: I like literature, so it was a treat to learn about various artists including Lope de Vega. Location is excellent--practically across the street from the Prado. Service was excellent. Wifi had perfect reception Great place to experience Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: JuneAZ
Reviews.Content: I decided upon this hotel because we were only in Madrid for two days so its central location was ideal. Madrid is a vibrant city with dinner and night life starting no earlier than ten! Being able to sightsee, shop, eat, drink, all within an easy walking distance was so worth it. The hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful during our stay. We had a family room for three and it was a little small but very clean. With the window open, it was a little noisy but the benefit of the location outweighed this. We only had the continential breakfast one morning but the buffet looked fresh and appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful small hotel, well located for the museums and other sites”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Danno
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lope de Varga has just about everything you need for a visit to Madrid -- it's clean, comfortable and friendly -- although they could pay a little more attention to details.The three main museums are all within walking distance, as are the Botanical Gardens, the Retiro and the stops for the tourist buses. It's worth exploring up the hill away from the Paseo del Prado, where you'll find interesting bars, restaurants and shops. The real (not Real) Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location as near all museums”
Reviews.Author: littlescotch
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel ,but room fairly small looking across into other buildings.A little noisy from time to time with people moving around as floors are wood with no insulation..Instructions for TV channels difficult to work They need more international stations ie English and French and different way of using the remote.Also they need Eurosport .They had it in the Library but was not told of it .The US open tennis was on and not available in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond...”
Reviews.Author: AnitaRG
Reviews.Content: I was already impressed by this hotel which has all the comforts and almost the size of a typical American hotel, including free wireless Internet. The location near the major museums makes it ideal for regular tourists. It is very clean and has individually controlled AC and heat. Their 12 euro all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet is ample and varied and free Spanish language newspapers are available to read while you eat. The only major drawback which has been mentioned in other reviews is the minimal soundproofing. Last night a couple was arguing somewhere nearby and I could hear every word of the discussion. There are also some staff who use excessive amounts of cleaning products -- your nose will have no doubt that your room has been cleaned but those who are sensitive to strong odors may need to throw open the window for a bit. The service has been impecable and cheerful but especially so when I returned late Saturday night in a total panic because someone had lifted my wallet with passport, all money and credit cards. The desk person on duty helped me calm down and directed me to the nearest police station to file a report, she loaned me 10 euros out of her personal money so I could get something to eat until I could get money wired from the US. When I got back from the police station she helped me phone the US embassy. The staff's patient and supportive attitude and being OK with getting the balance of my bill in cash because I had to cancel the credit card they had on file has been wonderful. Although, due to the pickpocketing incident I'm not sure I want to go back to Madrid any time soon, if and when I come back, I can't imagine staying anywhere other than the Hotel Lope de Vega. These people deserve a hospitality award for making a horrible situation bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: AlanLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere within easy walking distance of the tapas bar and restaurants in Plaza Santa Ana and Plaza Mayor, and this hotel certainly fits the bill being only 10-15 mins away. The room was a little on the small side - but was modern and spotlessly clean, with a nice balcony. Service was friendly. Would book again - Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: gorsar
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel and a very clean environment. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Free apples were available on the corridor. Rooms are large and ideal even for families. Breakfast was awesome. We suggest this hotel! It is within walking distance to several places of interest and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, real appropriate for a leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: LuigiMoita
Reviews.Content: Nice room, with space enough for a extra bed for our child. The location is closed to the main museum and tour bus. Nice walking distance from centre main plaza and streets. Restaurants and Coffee shops near by. Friendly staff and a clean room. Small minus: rooms could have a better insulation, being slightly noisy. One could ear the other people taking a shower in the morning. Free wireless internet and a nice touch: fresh apples and candy on the corridors. I agree with the positive reviews about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Madrid hotel convenient to local attractions and transportation”
Reviews.Author: keysroberta
Reviews.Content: You can not go wrong with this hotel-step out of the hotel and the Prado is across the street; many nice restaurants near-by as well as shopping, tour bus(s) and metro. We found the staff friendly and helpful, our room spacious and clean. Really enjoyed the couch and extra table as we had been traveling a long time. Many Europeans hotels are smaller than US rooms, so this was a refreshing change. Some slight detection of smokey smell initially , but a great many Europeans smoke, so this could be from near-by rooms.

Reviews.Title: “"Could try harder"”
Reviews.Author: Reinalina
Reviews.Content: The hotel leaflet says the rooms here are Lope de Vega themed - that was news to me.Did they mean the single print of De Vega that I mistook for Shakespeare.....? The best thing about this hotel is its side street location in the centre of Madrid. The bed was comfortable, but the room had an unnecessary table and bed-settee which took up too much space. Although the decor was modern, the 2-tone grey walls and grey bedcovers, with white glass lights which cast a clinical cold light, was NEVER cosy. There were no drawers, so all my belongings had to be scattered on the units. Marred by a very ugly shower screen, the bathroom was otherwise clean and modern. The breakfast room had an excellent choice of food, I'm not sure about hot food as I don't have a cooked breakfast. The bar area always seemed to be empty and reminded me of a shool classroom. The staff were friendly and helpful. The worst thing about this hotel was the very noisy cleaning staff who clattered around at 7am every morning - still audible with my earplugs in. And as all the floors are uncarpeted, there were sounds of heels tapping around in the room above. Overall, this hotel just cannot call itself 4*. I have stayed in better 3* hotels, including in Madrid. I paid a 4* price and received 3* accommodation which felt like 2* at 7am each morning. It was not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location But Lacking in Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BritFrenchPol
Reviews.Content: As a picky traveler, I chose this hotel for its location and in that way it was perfect. Pick up for all the bus tours of Sevilla and Toledo were two blocks away, and the Prado Museum among three others were across the street. I like my hotels on quiet side streets, which this hotel is, and it was not the hotel's fault that a huge demonstration against the government went on the entire time we were there at the Bureau of Sanitation which was across the street, but it made for a less than quiet experience. When we arrived they had put us in a single bed room, but we had a voucher to show we requested twin beds and a quiet room. The twin room faced the street (and noise), but we were told there were no other choices. As non-smokers (I am asthmatic), we appreciated that there was not much smoke smell in common areas or shared ventilation. The desk help from the female staff was superb! They were gracious, went out of their way to make reservations and go through map routes with us, but the men were not warm, and not very helpful. The bellman was wonderful as was the breakfast girl who worked her bottom off! We tipped them daily. The bathroom was large and clean, but the tub was narrow and very slippery. We suggest a towel on the floor of the tub when showering. On my European Hard Hotel Bed Scale (1 cement to 5 comfy), the beds were a 3. A Caveat to Non-Smokers: One thing we didn't know before we got to Madrid was that it is a city behind in respect for people who don't smoke or have health issues. Ninety-five percent of the restaurants allow smoking in the majority of the place, with small areas called "Non-Smoking" that are not separated by any barrier, or if in a separate room, have an open door and smoke fills any non-smoking area. We found two restaurants through the concierge that are non-smoking (our tour guide to Toledo recommended one), but they were VERY pricey. We found a vegetarian take out place and brought food to the room every night, but it wasn't the paella and tapas we'd looked forward to.

Reviews.Title: “Great chouice near Prado!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTourist10
Reviews.Content: Location is superb. Front desk staff very helpful. Walk to Prado and dozens of restaurants. Go for the top floor suites with outdoor shower!

Reviews.Title: “This was our last hotel in our 4 week...”
Reviews.Author: aldeb001
Reviews.Content: This was our last hotel in our 4 week Europe trip.... And the worst! As other reviews have suggested, this is NOT a 4 star hotel. Given a room on the 4 th floor, within a few minutes it was evident that even though we requested a non smoking room, 2nd hand smoke fumes were seeping through fr adjoining rooms and public spaces. I was offered 2 other rooms, same story. Maybe this is just how it is in Madrid. The walls were paper thin, and no carpet anywhere, so even though the windows are double glazed for external noise, we were continually disturbed by our neighbours late comings and goings, not to mention other activities! The other issue was the over heating. Even though it was winter temperatures outside, we could not reduce our room temps.... Staff said it was "law" that aircon only operates fr the next mont (April)! so we had a hot, stuffy, stinky room for 3 nights. It was preaid, otherwise I was out of there! O on the plus side, location was sensational, across the road fr the Prado Museum(a must) and close to the old city, within walking distance to great restaurants, the main sites and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “good location, too noisy, do not leave things in your room”
Reviews.Author: ballotes
Reviews.Content: Yes, good location, but I would rather walk further and pay more. Way too noisy, I agree with other reviews on this. Had our room changed, no problem, but noise was worse as the wood floors came into play on the new floor. Staff cool, but polite. Clean enough, but smelly products/air fresheners that lingered days. Finally when I forgot my mobile and power brick for a laptop (completely my fault), and called as soon as I got home, the hotel insisted they were not there, and nothing could be done. Two days later and the final word is no sign of either. (there is no doubt they were in the room, 1 in the safe!) Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: DCTeach
Reviews.Content: The Lope de Vega is a nice hotel, directly across the street from the Prado. 10 minute walk to the main train station (Atocha), and a little longer on foot to the Plaza Mayor. Modern hotel in a modern district (Starbucks nearby). Pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “a great little find”
Reviews.Author: jmdny
Reviews.Content: hotel was very centrally located, rooms were small and simple, but clean and safe. hotel staff very friendly and helpful, and the price was right. i was definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cuddly
Reviews.Content: Booked via the hotel's internet and had instant confirmation. Sent them an email and received prompt reply. Stayed in a junior suite on the top floor of this hotel. A lovely suite with connecting sitting room - bedroom, huge bathroom and a terrace with outdoor shower! As I planned to visit the museums, I was pleased with the location of the hotel being 5 minutes' walk from the Prado and Thyssen's museum. Though it is in the centre of Madrid, it is located on a quiet side street and there is no traffic noise in the rooms, though I could hear waterpipe noise from other rooms. The staff was most attentive, and one helped me to use the free internet service. There is no restaurant in the hotel, though you can order food from a local restaurant and have it charged to your room bill. But there are many local restaurants in the area serving traditional Spanish food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zmartin
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the museums. Steps to Prado, Thyssen, close to the Reina Sofia and the Caixa Forum. Great tapas places within a few blocks. Really an ideal location. Lobby was a bit wanting. This is not a stylish hotel. But the room was nice, bathroom clean, etc. Some of the staff spoke English, which was helpful. They supposedly had wi-fi but I could only access it in the lobby--not in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ferbent
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at this older style hotel situated just next to the Prado museum. I like to stay in new or newly renovated hotels so this hotel wasn't for me. The rooms are a bit dated and had a strange smell but the fantastic location made up for it. I'm sure there are many better hotels out there for the same or similar price but if this is all that's available then go for it. There are so many things to do in Madrid, so it's not like you'll be spending much time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “bumped from Prado to this hotel - hotel very nice”
Reviews.Author: calytravel
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation at Hotel Prado. When we arrived, after a long flight, we were told we were being taken to a sister hotel. We weren't sure we were happy about this, but it turned out very well. We were driven to this hotel, and it was in a good location, very close to the art museums, as well as neighborhoods for walking. The room was very quiet, and also had curtains for making the room very dark - perfect after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel - but laminate floors make for noise!”
Reviews.Author: SadyeP
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot, but have to comment on the fact that having really loud laminate floors in a multi-story hotel doesn't make sense to me. We could hear everything from the room upstairs. Besides that and the fact that the front desk sent us to an awful restaurant nearby, we really liked this place. Great location makes up for a lot - and besides the clomping feet noises, it's pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Spanish Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The rooms were quite spacious (especially for a European hotel!) and clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. They spoke English pretty well, but a word of warning: not many people in the city as a whole speak English very well. Most restaurants have English menus, but that doesn't mean the waiters necessarily speak it. Luckily my wife speaks some Spanish and that really helped us navigate around the city. The location of the hotel is great! It is right across the street from the Prado museum, and very near to the metro station which means you can travel all around the city. It is near Neptune's fountain and lots of great restaurants and shops. Most people don't travel to Madrid in January, but we really enjoyed being there in the off-season. It meant the hotel was cheaper and it was less crowded. The fountains were frozen over but it was snowy and beautiful in its own right. There are many hotels throughout Madrid, but this one was charming, and in the perfect place for everything we wanted to see in the city. Each room is named after a different historical figure and there is a little description next to the door which is really neat. The next time we go to Madrid, we will definitely stay at the Hotel Lope de Vega again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Aircon”
Reviews.Author: deborah.w
Reviews.Content: On a positive note the hotel is in a great location, and the reception staff are very helpful. However the hotel is situated just off the Paseo del Prado which is a very busy street. The air conditioning didn't work at all in the first room that we had and the noise of traffic from the main road meant we couldn't open the windows. We got moved on the second night, but although there was slight improvement it was still not satisfactory. I would be very mindful of staying here if it was the height of the summer. My friends room had the same problem, so don't think it's an isolated issue. It the hotel sorted this out I would have no hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fa1949
Reviews.Content: visiting Madrid with my son ... quiet, great little hotel quality fresh fruit on every floor

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: tony273
Reviews.Content: Good functional rooms. Excellent buffet breakfast. Perfectly located for the museums and other attractions. Liked the free internet access for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lope the Vega Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyMacKeltar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in March at the Lope the Vega. The hotel was fabulous, cozy, clean and in a great location. Its staff was very friendly. From the bell hop to the receptionists to the girls in the cafeteria, they always had a smile on their faces and were always available to help. The room was very clean, perfect -size, modern and quite. The breakfast was excellent with new choices everyday of our stay. We will deffinitely stay again at the Lope the Vega. Regards, Isabel and David Botticello

Reviews.Title: “Loud”
Reviews.Author: Patreras
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, which is why I chose it. The service was great. Front dest was very nice, but my room was not cleaned very well. When I checked in late evening, I got to my room to find strong paint fumes and paint residue on the floor which I did not notice until I saw that my feet were white. There was a film on the entire floor. It was too late and I was too tired so I opened the window and turned on the fan. I read other reviews before I booked and wish I had heeded the advice of the reviewer who warned about the noise. The walls are so thin that you can hear everything. I was awakened several nights at 4 AM when my neighbors came home. I was then awakened early each morning with early rising tourists. If you stay, bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatMedart
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great location near the Prado. The rooms were very recently remodeled and quite lovely. The outside of the hotel is not that attractive but the inside is very nice. The included breakfast was wonderful. English was understood at the front desk and they were very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “best location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: lauramatte
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in lope de vega and I reccomend it. It is very well located, near to prado museum und in a district called la hortas, where you can find a lot of nice tapas bars. In about 5 minutes you reach the metro, but you don't really need it, because you can easily walk to all important points (gran via, plaza mayor, plaza del sol...). The room was small, but very clean and relative new. The bathroom was also clean and new. The air condition works well. The bed was quite comfortable. The breakfast buffet is small, but they keep filling everything up and you can find from cheese, to eggs, bacon, spanish ham, nice fruits, bread and sweets.. We really enjoyed our stay in lope de vega and we would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “5 minutes from Prado, Thyssen, & Reina Sophia”
Reviews.Author: Medievalist
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beaten. Ran back to the hotel for a short nap after a couple hours in the museums, walked from the metro stop and to the Atoacha train station. What's more it is an elegant hotel that offers fresh fruit to its guests. Since I wanted a quiet room, I asked for a room on a high floor at the back and was rewarded with a view of the Palace Hotel which was fine. Room was pleasant, bed was good, and the bath was terrific. Staff were moderately friendly. This was my big treat, and at least for the first night a splurge, but not overpriced for its location. Fair enough, in other words. But as an unaccompanied, older woman traveler, I did not feel particularly welcome.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PattyPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a not too fancy, reasonably priced hotel in Madrid at a location near all the tourist sites . Our daughter, who is studying in Spain this year told us about the Hotel Lope de Vega, where her group had stayed. First, the location is tucked into a side street right across from the main drag where the Prado is located. It is a perfect location! We walked everywhere. There is a great neighborhood with lots of tapas bars adjacent to the hotel. Around the corner is a good breakfast spot. The Plaza Mayor, the Palacio Real, the Thyssen, and the Parque de Buen Retiro and of course the Prado are all within walking distance. We like to walk and are pretty fit, but if you are not, there are always tons of cabs circling around. The hotel is clean and the room was fine, with a little balcony and a door you can keep open to get a nice breeze. At night though we closed the balcony door to keep out the street noise. The door was well insulated, so we did not hear anything.Only complaint is that we had requested a non smoking room and when we arrived the room clearly had been a smoking one. I was too lazy/tired to complain. Also could have done without the porn on the tv selector. Even if you don't want to see it there is a glimpse of it as you flip through the channels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: yayight
Reviews.Content: Just got back from stopping two nights at the above hotel. Location - Over road from Prado Museum, close to numerous bars and restaurants, 5-10 min walk from a couple of tube stations. Hotel - Very stylish and looks like being recently refurbished Staff - Very friendly but like somebody has already stated, wish they could have warned us about the " night charge " on Taxi's to the Airport If i went back to Madrid, would go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean, but can be noisy + overpriced breakfast”
Reviews.Author: UK_Traveller3000
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel - a good deal for about 90 euros/night (without breakfast or the 7% vat). It's right across from the Prado museum and an easy walk from the old town, so location is perfect. It was also clean, had a new-ish bathroom and a minibar (=fridge :)). The staff was nice and friendly - I thought they should've warned us of the surcharge for the taxi when we asked them to book one for our trip to the airport though. Now, the negatives...the floors aren't carpeted, which is good for cleanliness but terrible regarding noise levels. We requested a room facing the inner courtyard (depressing view) so it would be quieter, but we kept waking up from the cleaning ladies rumbling around in the morning. The hotel was also quite small - the room was of a reasonable size and the breakfast room was adequate but there was a general feeling of being a bit cramped. Breakfast was nice and fresh and there were a couple of options that increased in price. Continental breakfast was option 3, for 8 euros. It wasn't the cheapest but it did the job - the full buffet breakfast (which didn't include much more!) was overpriced at 14 euros - was not worth it. Overall, a nice experience, but I would lay down carpets!

Reviews.Title: “Super value”
Reviews.Author: Sergioo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in January 2007 for a couple of days. Service was excellent, front desk staff very accommodating. My room was nice, of good size and crisp clean. The hotel is very well located, although a little walk to the nearest metro stations. For 86 euros per night, I think I could not do better!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place & location”
Reviews.Author: juzepi
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this perfect 6 storey hotel directly across from the Prado. Not one complaint...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Madrid at Lope de Vega”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: This is a business class hotel. Once you get past that and the anonymous feeling you get from a business hotel, you're fine. There wasn't a lot of character to this hotel, it felt pretty "anonymous"...but other than that, my stay was excellent. For tourists, this hotel is located in the middle of the museum triangle. You are about 2 minutes on foot from the entrance to the Prado, 5 minutes to the Thyssen and 5-10 to Sofia Reina and the Atocha train station (good for daytrips out of town). There is a Starbucks and VIP within 2 minutes for snacks/drinks for the room and a choice of two metro lines within 7 minutes on foot. I easily walked to Puerta del Sol and Gran Via from the hotel as well, so if you are up for a walk, this is a great location for just about everything. There is free internet in the lobby. The staff is very friendly and seemingly one step ahead of you. The rooms are extremely clean and housekeeping does a good job keeping up with your mess (I was there 4 nights and really spread out all over the room). My room was a double and was ample size for two adults. The shower was comfortable and the bathroom bigger than European standards. I heard no street noise and no neighbor noise at all. My only complaint was how expensive the breakfast buffet was -- 12 euros. I stayed in two other hotels in Spain with buffets and they were half the price. I only wanted juice, cereal and a roll, yet had to pay full price as if I was eating the omelette, meat, fruit, etc. All in all this is a great choice for business and vacation travelers. I'd recommend it, particularly if you want to be that close to the museums and train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: llopez
Reviews.Content: Great location, particularly helpful and friendly staff. I don't think you can find a better value in Madrid. You can walk to everything and the best restaurants are just blocks away. We'd stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gigi63
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Lope de Vega. I was surprised that the rooms were not as small as some reviewers say they are. We've stayed in hotel rooms in San Francisco that were much smaller. A plus was the free use of the internet. We enjoyed being close to many dining options and never left the area for any meals. Overall a great travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is my place...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Madrid about three or four times a year. I have seen many hotels in that city from the expensive ones to the no so expensive. The reason why I rather in this place instead of somewhere else is simple. They have an excelent service, housekeeping and a very friendly staff. The location could not be more convenient. You are at a walking distance from the center, museums, tascas and stores. For those whom do not visit Spain often, the size of the rooms could seems a little small. Believe me, rooms in hotels in Spain, and most part of Europe are not as big as in the USA. That's why when an American go to places outside their country they see strange things. Anyway...this is my place to stay and I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: KrispyDuck
Reviews.Content: A friendly hotel with a slightly amateurish feel to it that I find rather nice. The reception staff couldn't be more helpful and cheerful. For example they went to great lengths trying to find a Halal restaurant for my colleague and spoke to one restaurant for us on the phone when we had trouble communicating. Internet access (cable) is free and fast. The room is spotlessly clean, well-lit and quiet (but then I was at the back so YMMV). The breakfast buffet (extra charge) was good with a mix of hot and cold dishes. We paid a basic daily rate of €65 per room booking directly with the hotel which I think is astonishingly good value for a city-centre hotel of this standard. The only thing that holds me back from giving a 5* is that everything seems small! The rooms are barely adequate in size. My colleague was miffed that he only had a shower - no bath (though my room at the same rate had both). The underground car park (extra charge) is nightmarishly small and difficult to navigate unless you are lucky enough to get one of the 2 or 3 easily accessible slots ... but at least it does have parking which is unusual in the city centre. If you just want somewhere nice to sleep in a great location and aren't worried about having loads of space then I thoroughly recommend this hotel and will probably stay there again ... but I'll be taking a taxi next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but.....”
Reviews.Author: Dedra28
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location- across from the Prado and walking distance to Gran Via, Plaza de mayor etc. The rooms are just average, which is why i don't understand such high reviews. The walls are paper thin and we could hear everything coming from next door- even the opening of drawers! The bathroom was large, which was a nice plus. If you can get this hotel for under $75 per night then it's a great deal! Otherwise just slightly above average.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: dbocca
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel quite a bit. The room was spacious enough and very clean, bathroom amenities very good quality. And the breakfast was trully exceptional. It eliminated the need for lunch completely. And the location is hard to beat, across the street from Prado and close to Huertas. It is really within walking distance from all the major objectives in Old Madrid, even Salamanca. The staff was also helpful and all spoke decent English. We only found two problems. First, the room was not ready when we arrived (it was around 2:30 PM), but they fixed it fast. And second, the hotel is extremely noisy, and I am not referring to the street noise. We could hear everything that was going on in the room next to us (one night, our neighbors came into the room at 4:00 AM and made noise for an hour). Plus, due to the hardwood floors, I could hear every footstep caused by lady shoes. But overall we would definitely stay in the same place when we'll visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “quite good”
Reviews.Author: sixpakjoe
Reviews.Content: for the money you pay its great value. okay we got 1st floor front of hotel so plenty of car horns beeping. try avoid that side of hotel. room was basic, so if u intend to spend a lot of time in room its not for you. otherwise, everything else good. brakfast is great,730 to 1130. plenty to offer. tv channels basic. cnn channel 19 as far as location, its across from prado art museum which is quite interesting. botanic gardens was huge anticlimax as no flowers etc to see as replanting now. we had to get taxi to sol and plaza mayor and anything else of interest. taxi 20-25 euro to from airport. subway a good 15 minutes walk away. we would stay here again, but only because it gives you your money's worth. book early.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lope de Vega -- A Strong Candidate for the Best Madrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr. Chuck Bauer
Reviews.Content: We appreciated the comments given by others using the tripadvisor's website, so we are returning their favor. My wife and I stayed at the Lope de Vega Hotel for nine evenings in November 2005. We would recommend this hotel as excellent, one of the best we have encountered in many years of travel. The hotel is clean, staff is helpful -- we don't speak Spanish - and most hospitable, and the convenient to everything location across the wide boulevard from the Museo Prado for the price has to be one of the best values in Madrid. Our room was European style in space, well appointed with modern furnishings and a comfortable bed. Housekeeping is absolutely high quality as was the service of the complete hotel staff. We did not take advantage of the hotel cafeteria; but the two breakfasts we took there were worthy of recommendation as well. But then, there are a sufficient number of good restaurants, tapas bars and cafeterias around the hotel to tempt the visitor. The only problem we encountered was the down Internet; but then at the suggestion of the hotel staff we walked a few blocks to the Hotel de Prado, the Lope de Vega's sister hotel, where we were provided Internet access. By the way, the Hotel de Prado looked as great as the Hotel Lope de Vega -- just in case the de Vega is fully booked. Obviously, we would stay at the Lope de Vega again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lfreitag
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lope De Vega in October 2005 for 3 nights. For the price, you absolutely can't beat it. I paid 255 Euro for 3 nights. As was said many times, it is across the street from the Prado. The area is a lot of fun. Head over to the next street, Calle De Las Huertas where there are lots of small restaurants and good people watching. Also, there was a really nice small restaurant just past the Plaza De Jesus where we had breakfast. There are 3 Metro stops which are about 10 minute walks. We walked to all 3 and the closest is probably Anton Martin although Atoche is probably easiest to find. As for walking, I think the estimates here to Puerta del Sol are not correct. Expect about 20-25 minutes. But central Madrid can easily be walked. We walked back from the Palace and it was very interesting and didn't take too long. If you are a light sleeper (which I am not), ask for a room not on the Calle Lope de Vega. I was on the Lope De Vega side and the car noise from Calle Del Prado could make it more difficult to get to sleep. One last thing. Watch your wallet! I was pickpocketed on the train. But as far as the Hotel, I wouldn't even try anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Barnstoneworth
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending three nights at the Lope de Vega - what a gem of a place! Thanks to the reviews already on the site I knew what to expect and I wasn't disappointed. The location is superb - on the doorstep of the big three and the other major attractions were within walking distance. The hotel itself was clean, welcoming and manned by helpful staff, the majority of whom spoke very good English. The room was of a good size, clean, efficient aircon - needed as it was pretty warm even in October and very importantly quiet! Good selection of food at the beakfast which set us up well for the day. Would certainly recommend the Lope de Vega and will stay there again when we next visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service at Lope de Vega in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: DoctorM
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at the Hotel Lope de Vega in Madrid in July 2005. Although the hotel is rated as 4 stars, it has an small and unassuming lobby and breakfast area. The rooms also are small but have excellent bathrooms, beds, and amenities. We found that the location was outstanding for visitors to Madrid: 5 mintues from the train station, directly across from Del Prado, 2 blocks from Thyssen Museum, and a block away from Starbucks. The front desk was extremely helpful in securing a airport shuttle at 4 am on a holiday for us. The price is also extremely attractive for this location: we paid less than 90 euros per night, not including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch All the Way Around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Situated on a quiet side street yet just a few minutes walk from the three biggie museums AND the hapening late-night haunts around Plaza Santa Ana, Hotel Lope de Vega is simply wonderful as far as location goes. Add to that comfortable, clean rooms and a fantastically friendly and professional front-desk staff, and you´ve a top-notch place to stay at in Madrid. For those of you looking to spend time in the Checua district, you´re looking at a 10 to 15 minute walk from the hotel. Not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: lunatech
Reviews.Content: If your goal is museum hopping in Madrid, or close proximity to the Atocha station this hotel is perfect. The Prado is literally across the street and the Reina Sofia is easily within walking distance. Small hotel, attentive staff, perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Helen_Carroll14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unbelievably close to all the museums, great restaurants and bars but located on a quiet street so the noise is not a problem at all. The hotel is very clean, nice size rooms with good bathrooms and the staff are very helpful. We took the metro from the airport and it was easy to find. If you are looking for a hotel that is clean, quiet but close to everything then it is perfect. I read a couple of reviews complaining about street crime and pickpocketing but we experienced none of this.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Lope de Vega
HotelInfo.Address: Lope de Vega,49, 28014 Madrid, Spain
